question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: try_from()] [Byte array validation] Beyond length checking, does try_from() validate that the input bytes represent valid field elements before attempting decompression? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: try_from()] [Error propagation] If encryption_elgamal::g1::PublicParameters::try_from() returns an error at line 140, is the error properly propagated without leaking sensitive information in the error message? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Struct: PublicParameters] [Field consistency] Can the enc and g_2 fields get out of sync if one is updated but not the other through unsafe code, breaking the PVSS protocol assumptions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Serialization atomicity] Is the two-step serialization (enc then g_2) atomic, or can concurrent serializations interleave causing corrupted output? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: try_from()] [Partial construction] If try_from() fails midway through constructing PublicParameters, are partially initialized fields properly cleaned up to prevent use-after-free? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: default()] [Parameter fixation] Can an attacker force all validator nodes to use specific public parameters by controlling when/how Default is called, enabling precomputed attacks on the DKG? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: default_with_bls_base()] [Cross-protocol confusion] Does reusing BLS parameters for PVSS create cross-protocol attacks where validators' BLS signatures can be interpreted as PVSS transcripts or vice versa? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: with_max_num_shares()] [Sybil amplification] Since with_max_num_shares() ignores n, can an attacker create thousands of fake validator identities and force the system to use the same parameters, making attacks cheaper? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Constants: DST and SEED] [Hard-coded parameters] Are the hard-coded DST and SEED values updatable through governance, or are validators locked into potentially weak parameters forever? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new_from_seed()] [Timing attacks] Does hash_to_curve take constant time regardless of input seed, or can timing variations leak information about the seed to network adversaries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: try_from()] [Timing oracles] Can the time taken by try_from() leak information about which validation step failed, allowing attackers to craft increasingly valid-looking malformed parameters? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Cache timing] Do group element compression operations access memory in patterns that leak information through cache timing side-channels? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Derive: PartialEq] [Timing-based equality] Do the derived equality comparisons terminate early on first difference, leaking bit-by-bit information about parameter values through timing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: try_from()] [Version migration] If NUM_BYTES or the serialization format changes in a protocol upgrade, will old on-chain parameters fail to deserialize, breaking DKG? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Trait: ValidCryptoMaterial] [AIP-80 compatibility] Does the empty AIP_80_PREFIX break compatibility with other cryptographic materials in Aptos that expect versioned prefixes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: default()] [Hard fork risk] If default() behavior changes in an upgrade (switching from default_with_bls_base to new_from_seed), will validators on different versions use incompatible parameters causing network split? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Constants: DST and SEED] [Governance immutability] Can these constants be updated through governance proposals, or would changing them require a hard fork breaking all existing DKG state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Struct: PublicParameters] [Pairing compatibility] Does the PVSS scheme use pairings e(g, g_2) between G1 and G2 elements, and are these pairings properly validated to prevent invalid pairing attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new_from_seed()] [Pairing degeneracy] Can the chosen g, h, and g_2 cause degenerate pairings that always evaluate to identity, breaking zero-knowledge proofs in PVSS? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: default_with_bls_base()] [Pairing relationships] When using BLS generator for g, are the pairing relationships e(g, g_2) = e(h, g_2) properly checked to prevent equation-solving attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Struct: PublicParameters] [G1/G2 asymmetry] Does the asymmetric use of G1 for encryption and G2 for commitments create exploitable imbalances in the security assumptions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: get_commitment_base()] [Polynomial binding] Is g_2 suitable for Kate-Zaverucha-Goldberg (KZG) or similar polynomial commitments, or could weak parameters enable polynomial forgery? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: get_commitment_base()] [Degree limitation] Does the single g_2 base limit the degree of polynomials that can be committed, potentially forcing truncation that leaks information about dealt secrets? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new_from_seed()] [Setup ceremony bypass] By using deterministic hash_to_curve instead of a trusted setup ceremony, could adversaries precompute attacks that would be prevented by proper MPC setup? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Memory allocation] Can an attacker force repeated calls to to_bytes() to exhaust validator memory through Vec allocations, causing DoS during DKG? (Medium)
